posts.title: Drury GO Celebrates Farmington Chamber of Commerce Membership with Ribbon Cutting
posts.content:
Last Tuesday, Drury GO welcomed the community to their Farmington campus to celebrate its new membership with the Farmington Chamber of Commerce with a ribbon cutting. Together, they will continue the initiative to bring affordable education and scholarship opportunities to the community.

Start Here: With the fall semester right around the corner, academic advisors are on campus helping students enroll, schedule classes, and answer questions for anyone interested in completing a post-secondary degree or earning a certificate to advance their career.

Your Way: Take affordable courses in the fields of Business, Leadership, & Communication; Public Service & Safety; and Health & Behavioral Science. Learn entirely online or in a hybrid format, including in-person courses with experienced instructors and direct access to guidance counselors.

Enrollment for Fall 2023 is still open. Start your application or request more information HERE.

posts.title: Right To Start Hosts NWA Summit for Entrepreneurs
posts.content:
Right to Start, a national nonprofit based in Kansas City, will gather business leaders and entrepreneurs from around the nation for a Celebration of Entrepreneurship at The Momentary on Aug 22, from 10a-4:30p.

Join the Conversation: The NWA Summit will showcase the work of Arkansas entrepreneurs, unveil new regional data, and highlight policy-in-action. Attendees will actively contribute and collaborate with entrepreneurs and policymakers to expand future entrepreneurial opportunities.

Join the Fun: Network with other business leaders during this day-long summit, including a lunchtime marketplace of local artisans and musicians, including the Marshallese dance group Oceanwave, an aerial performer, and more.

Fuel your entrepreneurial journey and register for Right to Start‚Äôs NWA Summit HERE.

posts.title: Update Your Houseplants at the Ozark Plant Swap
posts.content:
Update your houseplants and meet other green thumbs during the Ozark Plant Swap, hosted by Ozark Beer Company in Downtown Rogers, this Sunday, Aug 20, from 2-5p.

House Trained: This Swap will focus on house plants, so if you have any plants you're willing to part with, bring them along! You can also bring cuttings or seeds to exchange. And if you're not ready to let go of any plants, there will be plants available for purchase, too.

At the Bar: Pink Fern will have a booth showcasing beautiful terrariums, and By and By Studio will have a plant bar set up where you can choose a pot and plant and have it potted before you leave!

Find more details about Ozark Plant Swap HERE.

posts.title: USL Arkansas Announces First Hire
posts.content:
Yesterday, USL Arkansas announced Wes Harris as the club‚Äôs first official employee, taking on the vital role of Managing Director.

The Man: Harris moved to Northwest Arkansas in 2011, embracing the community as the ideal place to raise his family and call home. His profound love for the area, coupled with a deep understanding of what professional soccer clubs can do for communities, fuels his excitement to bring pro soccer to the region.

The Mission: As Managing Director of USL Arkansas, Harris's role will focus on community engagement, public relations, system and process development, fundraising, and more.

Keep up with USL Arkansas developments HERE.
